metadata.title: CVE-2023-24329 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue in the urllib.parse component of Python before 3.11.4 allowsattackers to bypass blocklisting methods by supplying a URL that startswith blank characters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15').
python3.4 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
